Task.TaskDescription: Problem: A teaching hospital has just installed a cell-phone based workflow monitoring system, and NEWLINE the workflow seems to be working quite well. When a few more doctors are needed in the hospital, the NEWLINE system texts their cell phone and the doctors walk across the street from their offices to the NEWLINE hospital. When the hospital doesn't need as many doctors, the system sends some of them back to their NEWLINE offices where they can do their research, read email, etc. until the next time they are needed. NEWLINE The system is set so that the doctor-to-patient ratio is 1 to 8. That is, there are 0.125 doctors per NEWLINE patient. When the system was turned on, there were 80 patients in the hospital and 10 doctors present, NEWLINE so just the right ratio was in place at that instant. However, things change. The number of patients NEWLINE admitted (i.e., added) to the hospital is 10 per hour on average. The number of patients discharged NEWLINE from the hospital (i.e., sent home) depends on the number of doctors working at the time. In general, NEWLINE for each doctor working during an hour, 3 patients are discharged. NEWLINE NEWLINE Goal: Graph the number of doctors working in the hospital each hour for 10 hours.
Task.ShortDescription:
the number of doctors in the hospital each hour = 
 the number of patients in the hospital this hour 
 * the doctor-to-patient ratio this hour. 
the doctor-to-patient ratio is 0.125. 
The number of patients in the hospital at the end of the hour = 
 the number of patients in the hospital at the end of the previous hour 
 + the number of patients admitted to the hospital this hour 
 - the number of patients discharged from the hospital this hour. 
 Initially, the number of patients in the hospital is 80. 
the number of patients admitted to the hospital each hour is given as 10. 
the number of patients discharged from the hospital each hour = 
 the number of patients discharged per doctor this hour 
 * the number of doctors in the hospital this hour. 
the number of patients discharged per doctor each hour is given as 3.
